results.title: Director, Product Design
results.description:
Real Vision helps people understand the complex world of finance, business, and the global economy with real in-depth analysis by real experts through the power of its community.

The company is on a mission to democratize the very best financial intelligence for all and become the one place where everyone lives their financial lives.

This enhanced platform will offer members different learning journeys that put them in control of their finances. Members will be able to watch videos, listen to podcasts, monitor market prices, analyze markets and economies, do technical analysis, create watch lists, read and publish research, monitor their portfolios, execute trades across both Tradfi and Crypto, and contribute to a thriving hive mind community.

We are looking to build a world-class product design org that makes our platforms and apps feel like magic. 

Reporting to the VP of Design, you’ll function as a player-coach – doing hands-on product design work while also helping other designers make our platforms and apps feel like magic. 

Your track record of putting communities and people at the center of everything has contributed to thriving human-centered cultures that make amazing consumer-facing products. Inspiring others to think big – really big -- to imagine what’s possible while zooming into the details gets you up every morning. 

What You Will Do 
Experience in these critical areas will set you up for success in this role.


Product Thinking:
  • Help turn strategy into product -- participating in and often facilitating jam sessions to go from insights to ideas 
  • Play a hands-on role when needed to create mock-ups and prototypes that help visualize how we go from ideas to action 


People Management
  • Lead a small groupof people (2-4) across IA, UX, and UI 
  • Recruit and onboard talent as we grow 
  • Provide continuous candid feedback to designers on their performance 
  • Identify and nurture future design leaders within Real Vision 


Design Execution
  • Balance hands-on design work with guiding& mentoring other designers 
  • Evolve our processes & principles to work better for our current stage of design maturity 
  • Partner with product leadership to drive executional alignment on our roadmap 
  • Provide feedback on prioritization, roadmapping, and scoping 
  • Help lead decisions around quality/effort tradeoffs 
  • Ensure design capacity is factored into roadmap decisions 
  • Support and/or lead concept design for new features -- contributing directly when necessary 
  • Develop a consistent, on-brand design system in partnership with Head of Creative 
  • Provide clear, effective feedback through written feedback, design crits, and 1:1 working sessions 
  • Help reinforce a culture where we ship quickly and often to help make better decisions 


Who you are:
  • You have managed design teams/orgs for 4+ years 
  • You have designed personalized digital experiences for different personas and their respective user journeys  
  • You have shipped digital products with a mix of features developed (a.) in-house and (b.) by 3rd-parties (i.e., lots of integration experience) 
  • You have worked across a diverse ecosystem of websites (desktop, mobile), native mobile apps (iOS, Android), OTT apps (AppleTV, AndroidTV, etc.), in-vehicle apps (CarPlay, Android Auto), and complex desktop apps (MacOS, Windows, Linux) 
  • You have been inside companies or agencies where speed, agility, and constantly shipping features mattered 
  • You have startup and/or early growth stage experience 
  • You have worked with diverse cross-functional groups that go beyond typical agile software teams 
  • You are familiar with agile product development processes... and understand when to deviate from what's prescribed based on what makes sense for the business 
  • You are wired to find solutions, take action, and get concepts out in the wild 
  • You embrace and educate others on product design best practices 
  • You believe in designing mobile-first and progressively enhancing from there 
  • You have a growth mindset 
  • You lead with positive energy 
  • You can juggle multiple things at once in stride 
  • You communicate ideas concisely and clearly 
  • You are passionate about finance and crypto and enjoy going down those rabbit holes 
  • Ideally, you are (or have been) a Real Vision subscriber or member 
  • You have a strong portfolio that shows how you've made complex digital products dead simple to use 


What we offer:
  • Real Vision is 100% remote 
  • Competitive salary 
  • Equity grants 
  • 100% covered health, dental, vision for the individual employee (with family coverage at a heavily reduced rate) 
  • Favorable 401K 
  • 20 days PTO per year (4 weeks), US holidays and 5 sick days 
  • Growth opportunities in a collaborative, authentic, passionate culture 
  • Real Vision All Access membership 
CONTACT 

Tim Coil at Tim.Coil@realvision.com

results.title: UX Designer, Product
results.description:
Onebrief makes military planning seamless and represents a shift in paradigm for future military decisions. It is an all-in-one tool that supports both the creative and process-oriented aspects of military planning. In Onebrief, planners use maps, boards, diagrams, timelines, spreadsheets, slide decks and text documents to create their plans—all while sharing a common database. Everything stays in sync, in real time. Our approach has been refined and validated through hundreds of user experiments.

We’re post-revenue (approaching $2M in ARR). We are backed by Y Combinator (S21) and top-tier VCs, including Caffeinated Capital (Affirm, Docker, Notion, and more). Our elite team combines the best of tech and military talent, including education and experience at Google, Adobe, Delta Force, TOPGUN, and more.

Given our current traction we can barely keep up with demand. This is an opportunity for you to join us with all the perks of a founding employee.

What you will achieve

As a product designer at Onebrief, your job will be to solve complex military planning problems and help develop a seamless, end-to-end planning tool.

You will have the opportunity to travel and partner with military planners from around the world, empathize with their needs, and translate those into design solutions. You will have the support of a team of engineers and another product designer. Your work will span across UX, UI, and user research and will cover all facets of the product, from defining ground-up new features to shaping our design system.

Most importantly, you'll work as a true partner to our founders, with plenty of flexibility to reshape your role over time as needed for yours and our company's success.

You’ll report to Johnny Hunter, our lead designer.

About You

"Any darn fool can make something complex; it takes a genius to make something simple." — Albert Einstein

The ideal candidate has worked on B2B/SaaS projects where innovative design was vital to their success. We are especially interested in projects involving aspects of creative support, data visualization, or modern collaboration.

Qualifications

  • You are a trained and experienced (3+years) interaction and visual designer

  • You can discover what users truly need even when they don't understand it themselves

  • You work iteratively and naturally seek collaboration

  • You communicate clearly and succinctly

  • You can handle HTML, CSS and some Javascript (enough to code finishing touches, small improvements and prototypes yourself)

  • You are a U.S. citizen

  • Finally, you are a manager of one—capable of setting your own direction, building something from scratch, and seeing it through

About Us

Our team shares a passion, seek excellence, and play to win, with the seriousness and camaraderie of an olympic team. We are in this together, not just because Onebrief will one day be 10x the size of Palantir. We are here to build the future of military decisions, so that the coming decades don’t repeat the previous ones.

Here’s what our team members value most about working here:

  • Founders' transparency

  • Product and vision

  • Leadership's ability to learn and adapt

  • Challenges and learning opportunities

  • Ownership and autonomy

  • No non-sense policies and processes

  • Remote-first, as opposed to remote-friendly

What's in it for you

  • $145k - $180k salary/year

  • Equity

  • Remote work, flex time, and unlimited PTO

  • Health, dental, vision, and life insurance

  • 401k

  • Parental leave

results.title: Product Designer
results.description:
Sound is hiring a Product Designer to help shape the future of a new music economy that values artists and their music while connecting fans more closely to the music they love.

Sound is a suite of web3-native music and economic tools powering the next generation of artists and their communities. We’re passionate about helping artists capture more value from their art, and connecting fans more closely to the music they love. Since launch, we’ve onboarded over 200 artists (including Snoop Dogg, Pussy Riot, Salem Ilese, RAC, Soulection, and more) and generated over $3.7 million in proceeds that have gone directly to those artists.

As a Product Designer, you'll work closely with the Head of Design to formulate our product vision. You'll work directly with artists and listeners to build an intuitive and delightful experience for our users. You'll design, build, and maintain our suite of tools for artists and their communities, all while setting a high bar for design thinking, quality, and systems.

What you'll be doing:

  • You will champion the end-to-end user experience and own all aspects of design strategy, visual design, and interaction design

  • You will establish design best practices and consistently apply them to how we execute on our roadmap

  • You will design and iterate on prototypes while incorporating feedback from artists/collectors and technical requirements from the engineering team

  • You will create the foundations of our design systems and work closely with our product and engineering teams to constantly improve the user experience

  • You will conduct user research interviews and usability testing sessions

  • You will help to create a world-class design culture with an extremely high-bar for quality

 

Who we're looking for:

  • You have 3+ years of experience with a proven track record of product thinking, visual design, and interaction design for consumer-facing products

  • You have a strong portfolio of relevant design work that conveys your ability to ship and focus on outcomes

  • You have a bias towards action and a curiosity-driven approach to solving problems in a fast-paced, and often ambiguous environment

  • You have a passion for music and are as excited as we are to design the future of music

     

Nice-to-haves:

  • Knowledge and understanding of NFTs and crypto

  • Familiarity with Ethereum and web3, and the nuances of wallets, tokens, transactions, etc.

 

Sound benefits:

  • We offer top-of-the-line benefits, including health, mental health, dental, and vision insurance.

  • Remote-first teamwork with team and community members around the world

  • Work-from-home/remote office stipend

  • Team offsites for periodic collaborative strategy sessions in person

  • Passionate, supportive team dedicated to learning and growing together in web3

Sound is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, age, civil or family status, disability or race.

results.title: Graphic Designer (Performance Ads)
results.description:
Libertex Group is looking for a performance ads designer to join our one-of-a-kind in-house creative studio. We have an international team consisting of creative professionals with different talents and backgrounds. Now we are looking to add one more static designer to this awesome group of people.

Job Overview

The Designer will be responsible for creating banners strictly used in user-acquisition/performance campaigns (SM channels) and adapting them to various formats and styles in line with our corporate brand guides.

What Will You Do?

  • Produce banners for performance campaigns in social media channels;
  • Work on routine tasks such as localization, batch-production and exporting;
  • Work closely with the creative director and the art director. Collaborate on a daily basis with the social media manager;
  • Take active part in the creation of concepts and visual assets for ad campaigns;
  • Create work for high-profile brands from the online trading and crypto industry;

Requirements

  • 1-3 years of experience in graphic design or equivalent;
  • Proficient use of Adobe CS Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator etc), Figma and all of its functions;
  • Solid understanding of the digital marketing ecosystem (SM / SEM / Google Display / App Stores etc);
  • English language - fluent
  • German language - fluent
  • Proven creative background;
  • Ability to quickly “juggle” multiple projects with different magnitudes
  • A proactive approach, evaluating creative trends and always on the lookout for the next best-converting banner;
  • Experience in producing Facebook ads for complex niche industries (e.g. like finance or crypto, where testing of dozens/hundreds of creatives is required to find the one creative that convert best).
  • Technical know-how of Facebook, TikTok and Instagram ad campaigns.
  • Good understanding of metrics like CPM, CPC, CTR, CPL etc.

Additional Skills (not obligatory)

  • Experience in batch production (tools like Bannersnack, Creatopy and others);
  • 3D software knowledge (tools like Blender, Maya etc)
  • Creative agency background (or a similarly versatile environment);
  • Good understanding on how to use Google Sheets/Docs and Zoom;
  • Knowledge of how to use Jira or similar project management tools;
  • Previous trading industry experience;

Benefits

We Offer

  • 25 working days annual leave + Germany Public Holidays
  • Comprehensive Global Medical Insurance Plan, with coverage for the employee and their immediate family from day one
  • Udemy for Business Unlimited Membership
  • Ongoing professional and personal development


Application (CV & portfolio) in ENGLISH is a must.

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
*This job is remote-friendly for all candidates currently authorized to work in the United States or Canada.

We are Battlefy, and we power Esports.

We are looking for a Senior UX Product Designer with a background in user behavior research to join our team and help us build the future of Esports. Battlefy's platform is the gold standard in esports and we need smart, agile people to help deliver world-class experiences for players and organizers.

The Senior Product Designer will be responsible for supporting the continual development of the Battlefy product and tools by providing iterative designs, research, and testing towards our desired outcomes. At the same time, the Designer will help to identify opportunities to turn problems into product solutions in order to improve, standardize and lower the cost of delivering individual projects.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with Product Managers to create and conduct research plans, experiments, and implement new experiences
  • Maintain a deep understanding of Battlefy’s Design System(s) and manage requested system improvements
  • Translate company goals, product strategy, and research findings into actionable product experiments and prototypes
  • Act as the voice of the user in all product planning and execution stages
  • Create user flows, wireframes, low/high fidelity mockups, interactive prototypes, and understand what the idea design artifact is for a given project
  • Work collaboratively with developers to translate experiences and components into production code

Requirements

  • 3+ years of experience working in UX or design
  • Ability to conduct user testing and iterate on findings
  • Proficient with modern design tools: ideally Figma but also Sketch or XD
  • Solid understanding of modern UX activities and best practices
  • Ability to empathize with users and think analytically to solve problems for users and the business
  • Extensive familiarity with prototyping and iterative design cycles

Benefits

At Battlefy, you will be instrumental in helping the team to rise up and become legends. While doing so, you will receive a competitive salary, flexible hours, programs to support outdoor fitness activities, and flexible vacation time. Most importantly, you will receive the support of a talented, warm, and welcoming family that shares your passion and enthusiasm for building a legacy.

results.title: Junior Designer
results.description:
Location: Europe, remote

This is a freelance position requiring roughly 20 hours per week, with the potential to develop into a full-time in-house position.

 

Who is Vev?

We’re a Norwegian design-tech startup working to make the web a more beautiful place. Our web creation platform is already helping professionals publish their wildest ideas on the web with complete creative and technical freedom. With ambitious growth goals, we’re now looking for a talented Junior Designer.

 

About the role

As a Junior Designer, you will be a visual thinker who can help us solve problems with hands-on skills and creative problem solving. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of graphic design principles and design thinking. Reporting to the Creative Director, you will work as part of the in-house creative team to create engaging designs according to requirements. In this role, you should be highly creative and have a sharp eye for details. If you’re passionate about design and eager to learn more, we’d like to meet you.

What you’ll be doing
  • Create impactful designs that capture and promote the Vev vision
  • Understand project requirements and concepts
  • Understand and follow the requirements of Vev’s brand identity
  • Create dynamic and engaging websites and various landing pages in Vev
  • Use various techniques to produce drafts, prototypes and engaging design solutions
  • Listen to feedback to hone skills and improve design
  • Collaborate with other designers and team members to launch projects and ensure high-quality work

Requirements

 
  • 1-3 years of experience in the creative industry, or equivalent
  • BFA/BA in Design or a related field
  • Experience with design software (i.e. Adobe CC, Figma)
  • Familiarity with design techniques and a strong understanding of visual elements and design principles
  • Teamwork and communication skills
  • A keen eye for detail
  • Time management and multitasking abilities
  • Critical thinker with creativity skills and problem-solving aptitude
  • Experience working in a fast-paced, high-growth business environment
  • Self-motivated, proactive, and able to work independently
  • Fluent English speaker

 

Ideally, you’ll also have:

  • Familiarity with web design space, HTML, and CSS
  • Good understanding of web design principles
  • Experience with Vev or alternative website platforms
  • Familiarity with video editing or motion graphics

FAQ

Our Hiring Process

  • Application review
  • A short portfolio review with our Creative Director
  • An Interview with our Creative Director
  • An Interview with one of our VPs / co-founder

Benefits

  • We value a good work-life balance, so working hours are flexible (core hours for meetings are 10.00 to 15.00).
  • A diverse team with a remote work culture (17 different nationalities on the team)

results.title: User Researcher
results.description:
What You’ll Accomplish:

  • Work closely with Product Designers and Product Managers to support team-level research objectives and testing needs.
  • Assist Senior User Researcher with higher-level strategic research projects.
  • Support feature teams with mixed method studies (prototype testing, interviews, surveys, etc.)
  • Build research toolkits to empower colleagues to learn and apply research skills, adopt user-centric mindsets, and synthesize previous research findings.
  • Use a wide range of qualitative and quantitative research methods (mixed methods) to uncover user pain points and opportunities (field studies, workshops, ethnography, user testing, etc.).
  • Develop relationships with customers and access in-person sessions with users to explore how they operate in their environment.
  • Receive direction, guidance, and feedback from our senior user researcher on a weekly basis to achieve research objectives.
  • Lead collaborative analysis and synthesis for research findings, communicate results to stakeholders and product team, and contribute to research repository.

Requirements

Who You Are:

  • Ideally you have at least 2-5 years of professional experience working on a research team at a technology company where you were not the only researcher.
  • User Research experience preferably with an eCommerce and/or SaaS, technology company.
  • You have experience with a variety of generative and evaluative research methods, including (but not limited to) in-depth interviews, ideation sessions, customer journey mapping, usability evaluation, surveys, benchmarking, and concept testing.
  • Preferably a degree in a related field (e.g. Behavioral science, social psychology, HCI, CS, UX) and 2-5 years of industry experience or, any equivalent combination of experience and/or education from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been achieved.
  • You have clear and concise communication skills.
  • You’ve had success in setting and achieving priorities that find balance between business needs and research objectives while attending to stakeholder needs.
  • You have experience crafting compelling stories to explain your work, process, and decisions to cross-functional stakeholders.

Benefits

Why You Should Join Us:

Our vision is to make it fast and easy for auto repair shops to find the right parts across all of their suppliers with one search. Together, PartsTech’s team helped countless businesses save valuable time so they can focus on their customers — and we’re just getting started.

The PartsTech team is a global, distributed group of passionate self-starters based in Cambridge, Hartford, CT, Eastern Europe and beyond. We are remote-first, privately held and venture-backed.

PartsTech is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and values diversity at every level of our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We believe you should bring your whole self to work, so come as you are.

Benefits:

  • Flexible PTO
  • Health Savings Account or Flexible Spending Account
  • Dependent Care FSA
  • 401(k)
  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Vision insurance
  • Life Insurance
  • Employee Assistance Plan
  • Supplemental Insurance
  • Commuter Benefits
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Summer Fridays

results.title: UX Designer
results.description:
Company Description

Our mission is to help people think and feel better about money

Founded in 2020 by experienced fintech founders, Dimply is backed by high-profile industry investors and VCs. We are building tools to help millions of people improve their relationships with money while making them financially happier. To reach as many people as possible, we provide our platform to enterprise customers who use it to help their customers engage with their finances.

At Dimply, you will have a direct impact on our product, our users, our organisation, and our engineering practices.



Job Description

Why You Should Join Our Design Team:

Our team is mighty but small, so your design and input will have a big impact on how the product is shaped. We're culture first at Dimply and a nice bunch of humans who are natural collaborators. You will take an active role in shaping our design culture and the future of thousands of people’s financial happiness. We have implemented server-driven UI (before Airbnb made it popular!) to ensure we can deploy across all platforms quickly with our ever-improving feature list.

You care about helping make a real difference in people's financial lives and are genuinely curious and effective in building complex, scalable systems. You have the unique opportunity to build and scale our core products.

What can you expect:

Simply put, as a strong product designer you will help us design great looking and intuitive products. Your main task will be to work with Dimply’s awesome engineering team to design customer-centric products.

Other responsibilities may also include:

  • Understand product specifications and user psychology
  • Define the right interaction model and evaluate its success
  • Develop wireframes and prototypes around customer needs
  • Find creative ways to solve UX problems (e.g. usability, findability)
  • Communicate design ideas and prototypes to developers
  • Keep abreast of competitor products and industry trends
  • Create overall concepts for the user experience within our products
  • Analyze customer responses and product data to determine what visuals perform better than others
  • Design the aesthetics to be implemented within our product, from the layouts and grips to buttons and iconography



Qualifications

What can make you successful in the role

  • Proven experience as a UX Designer, UI Designer or similar role
  • Strong multi-platform portfolio of professional UX/UI design.
  • Experience with product design software as Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD or InVision Studio.
  • Experience in design thinking methods.
  • Exceptional creativity, originality and attention to detail.
  • Creative problem-solving skills to find solutions to complex product problems.
  • Strong portfolio of design projects
  • Knowledge of HTML/CSS; JavaScript is a plus
  • Problem-solving aptitude
  • Analytical mind with a business acumen
  • Excellent communication skills



Additional Information

Why Dimply?

Besides working with a great bunch of humans, we are a remote-first company. Our team is currently spread across multiple time zones and we feel we are a great place to work! We operate out of Dogpatch Labs in Dublin. When you join, you will receive a work from home budget to help you get set up to be successful. If working from home is not for you and getting to Dogpatch is not ideal, you can avail of our monthly co-working facility support.

results.title: Game7 - Creative Director
results.description:
Who we are

Game7 is an Autonomous GameFi Institution whose treasury is managed and deployed by the community. Our mission is to make web3 gaming sustainable by accelerating the industry towards collaboration, unified standards, open source innovation and having fun.

To achieve this, both BitDAO and Forte have committed $500m to our treasury. Our community then helps decide how to deploy strategic capital towards both Investments and Grants that help drive the ecosystem forward.

As a community, we are passionate about crypto, gaming and are comprised of industry leaders and blockchain experts, who believe there are better ways to build distributed organizations. Our community consists of diverse, talented and intelligent members who’s contributions to the ecosystem help define their governance capabilities.

We’re looking for the next generation of leaders and doers who have a passion for crypto and are looking to influence the future of DAOs, DeFi, Web3 and GameFi. If you’re a self-starter, believe in autonomy and ownership, then we encourage you to apply for this role.

 

About this team

The community is made up of crypto, gaming and DeFi veterans who are passionate about crypto, gaming and distributed entities.

 

Your craft

We’re looking for talented Art Directors who obsess over every pixel, and who have deep experience crafting identities and maintaining brand personalities across multiple mediums and formats including product, events, merchandise, media and more. Your responsibility is to drive artist direction, style guides, and brand guidelines that shape the way the brand is communicated to the public.

  • Min. 5 years experience leading agencies, or teams

  • Web3 and Gaming knowledge or experience

  • Fluent in Figma, Adobe Creative Suite and other Design Tools

  • Excellent time-management and organizational skills

  • Knowledge of online content strategy and creation

  • Proven experience as an Art or Creative Director or related role

If you think you have valuable experience to bring to the organization, but don’t necessarily meet all of the criteria for the role, we still want to hear from you. We consider all applications.

 

Extra credit

If you have experience, knowledge or experience in Web3, Gaming, DeFi, GameFi, DAO’s or other gaming and blockchain specific areas then we consider this an excellent skill set.

 

Why work with us?

We do things a little differently here at Game7, as you’d expect from the blockchain. We promise a culture of flexibility, autonomy, and the freedom to contribute to the wider Web3 ecosystem.

Also: a fully remote working environment. Our compensation packages are reflective of the experience and value you bring to the organization and individual projects.

  • Base pay USDC, paid monthly

  • Work Supplies, HW & Home Office Equipment

  • Co-working space or home office-related expenses

  • Any learning or education materials related to work

  • Travel related expenses that are related to work

  • Any expenses related to food and entertainment for work

  • Any expenses related to both physical or mental health and well-being

 

We’re committed to fostering a progressive work environment that’s centered on forgiveness, empathy, belonging, and psychological well-being. Game7 is an equal opportunities workplace that doesn’t discriminate based on race, ethnicity, gender, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status, or any other legally protected status.

results.title: Product Designer
results.description:
PRODUCT DESIGNER

We are seeking a mid-weight Product Designer looking to build the next generation of 3D projects. The ideal candidate will have a holistic approach to product design, and a portfolio that covers both UX and UI processes. We are also conducting user research, so experience in user research is preferable but not essential.

Responsibilities

This position will report to the Head of Design and will work with cross-functional team members such as Technical engineering heads, product owners, etc.

● Maintain and improve large design libraries

● Create new components for high-fidelity mockups

● Identify new product improvement opportunities

● Analyze how a new product satisfies market needs and consumer preferences

● Stay up to date on current industry trends and market conditions

● Work closely with senior designers

● Coordinate with product engineers

● Present ideas to cross-functional teams and senior leadership

Requirements

This is a mid-weight position, so we expect you to have around 3 years experience as a UX/UI or Product Designer

● Good knowledge of accessibility, usability and design patterns.

● Good Figma skills – we do everything in Figma ✨.

● Experience working with design systems and shared libraries.

● Skilled at creating components and working with variants and instances.

● Ideally you’re also a wizard with auto-layout and responsive design. You always consider

different screen sizes.

● A well-rounded portfolio of client work – we work with many different stakeholders and

teams, so you must be comfortable working on varied projects.

● Ability to think through a problem by crafting user stories, user flows and wireframes.

● Creativity and willingness to push the visual design. We want to make beautiful and

delightful apps.

● Passion for design. Fortunately, we work in an industry that’s open to new ideas, so if

you want to try something weird, we’ll probably enjoy it.

Benefits

● 100% remote & flexible hours

● Growing challenging environment

● Learning possibilities (conferences, meetups, courses, etc.)

● Additional equipment

● Paid days off

results.title: Production Designer
results.description:
At Gigasavvy, our Creative Team does much more than create pretty designs. We strive to understand every aspect of the consumer journey. We are storytellers at heart who love to create belief in our clients’ products and services.

As a member of the team, the Production Designer will do everything from the creation of design mocks for social & digital campaigns, to website design, print, packaging, as well as brand identity and creative campaign ideations.

The Production Designer's PASSION for marketing and advertising, the desire to make great work, and how this person solves problems on a daily basis are all key factors in thriving at Gigasavvy.


Core Responsibilities

  • Collaborate closely with art directors, designers, account managers and brand strategists
  • Prepare final press-ready files based on supplied specifications for several types of printing
  • Make various formats of supplied artwork production-ready and resolve any artwork issues that arise during production
  • Provide image retouching, clipping paths and additional image manipulation
  • Package and preflight files for release to printers or media partners
  • Create PDFs for print and client review
  • Prepare images for online and mobile applications
  • Follow a development timeline to ensure tasks are being completed on time
  • Troubleshoot problems as they arise with both the creative team and the printer
  • Develop and grow other design skills such as animation and after effects


Qualities

The ideal candidate has:

  • A passion for design and creative marketing
  • A drive to learn and adapt to a fast-paced environment
  • A desire to seek inspiration and share that inspiration with others
  • A humble and hungry attitude
  • A proactive approach to addressing problems before they arise
  • A love for what you do

Requirements

  • BA/BS degree required (design concentration preferred)
  • 2-4 years of experience as Production Artist within a product company, design studio, creative agency, printing company or print publication
  • Experience with digital content such as websites, social media, rich media, online advertising and email campaigns
  • Proficient in Photoshop, Illustrator, & InDesign
  • Ideally, familiar with After Effects & Premiere
  • Experience working in an agency environment is a plus
  • Ability to multi-task on a daily basis
  • Collaborates well with a team
  • Willingness to learn and adjust to complex situations on the fly
  • Drive to challenge current design trends (what makes them work)
  • Ability to present ideas and concepts both internally and directly to clients
  • Ability to effectively communicate timelines and the status of projects
  • Proven ability to ensure that brand voice, concepts, themes and/or messaging are accurately represented in design
  • Expertise in managing multiple assigned project tasks in a strict deadline-driven environment
  • A positive disposition in a fast-paced environment and during demanding times

results.title: Senior Gameplay Designer
results.description:
Company Description

Daily Responsibilities:

  • Mentoring experience. 
  • Openness for changes & experimentation, high-quality passion and a good sense of humor are appreciated!



Additional Information

Working mode

For this role you can choose between a remote-first or office-first working mode.

  • Office-First: working primarily from the Warsaw, Wroclaw, or Cracow studio for a minimum of 10 days per month.
  • Remote-First: working from home, or from any location that is within 3 hours of the GMT+2 time zone.

Perks & Professional Growth

  • Flexible working hours — start your workday anytime between 8:00 and 10:00 AM.
  • A welcome pack filled with goodies — to help you feel right at home once you join the team.
  • Trainings, lectures and courses — internal workshops, external training for each employee, ‘Meet a star’ events, knowledge-sharing initiatives, online tutorials, and e-learning classes are all available. There’s always something to learn!
  • Merch — employee store discounts at CD PROJEKT RED Gear, gifts for newborn rebels and regular chances to nab some cool swag!

Health & Well-being

  • Private medical healthcare — a selection of medical plans with dental care to choose from, which are also accessible for your partner and relatives.

Social Activities & Life in the Office

  • Dog-friendly office — dog owner? Bring your pooch with you and look after them while working! There’s always a furry friend or two to meet at the studio.
  • Social events — we host regular gatherings at the studio where we can all unwind, play games, and just have some fun together.
  • Healthy selections — ​​organic fruit, snacks, muesli, organic honey, vegan milk, and specialty coffee are all at your disposal around the studio. Enjoy!
  • Truly international working environment — a chance to meet and work with a diverse selection of people from all around the world.

Head office in Warsaw

  • Sustainable campus with an eco ethos — solar panels provide green energy, 2000 plants and an air-filtering system to help provide clean air, electric car charging points, flower meadows, and more green features in the works.
  • An onsite, well-equipped gym with a climbing wall and a personal trainer available every day and pilates classes.
  • Car and bike parking spaces.
  • A designated space for your bicycle, as well as bicycle repair equipment and showers available whenever you need them. 
  • No dress-code — we like to keep it casual.

Relocation support

  • Relocation package – flight ticket, company apartment for your first month, relocating your pet, shipping your belongings: it’s all covered. Who said moving countries needs to be complicated?
  • Relocation assistance — processing your legalization operations for you, assistance with finding residence, tax settlements, helping out with translations if needed, and much more —  we have dedicated teams to help make sure that all you need to feel right at home is taken care of.

results.title: Product Design Lead
results.description:
VotingWorks is hiring a Product Design Lead to simplify election technology. This role will own software product design for all VotingWorks products: our voting system, risk-limiting auditing software, and more.

About VotingWorks

VotingWorks is the only non-profit in the United States building voting machines, audit software, and other technology to power our public elections. We believe in democracy and well-run free & fair elections. We see a growing crisis of voter confidence in our elections, and we believe transparent, secure, and simple technology can help. That's what we're building. Voting technology developed in concert with election administrators, with all source code and documentation published for the world to see, modern security practices that provide positive evidence of proper operation, and a focus on simplicity in our product so users make fewer errors.

The Role

The Product Design Lead will own software product design for all VotingWorks products and will report to Head of Product.

You'll be responsible for:

  • Designing the user experience for new product features that solve problems we are prioritizing.
  • Working in the best medium for the stage of the product development lifecycle you're in, whether that be documents, sketches, high-fidelity mockups, or prototypes.
  • Conducting user research and usability testing to confirm design hypotheses.
  • Defining the design system for the user interface across the VotingWorks product suite.
  • Helping with other organizational design needs such as graphic design for marketing assets.
  • Developing a deep understanding of user needs and constantly pushing VotingWorks to simplify product design.

We're looking for someone who:

  • Has 5+ years of experience designing software products for a diverse set of users.
  • Rapidly prototypes designs in Figma, code, or other interactive tool of choice.
  • Methodically breaks down a product problem statement into product design hypotheses and tests these hypotheses with users.
  • Builds design systems that enables engineers to move faster and collaborates to understand technical feasibility of designs.
  • Knows how to balance attention to detail and shipping features.
  • Wants to put their skills towards increasing public trust in elections.
  • Nice to have: experience as the first design hire at an early stage startup. You will initially be the only designer at VotingWorks.
Location, Teamwork, Work-Life Balance

VotingWorks is a fully distributed organization. Team members work from wherever they choose in the United States and attend meetings over video or audio conference. Work when you prefer, as long as you can be available 4 hours per weekday during Pacific timezone business hours for team coordination. We use Slack a lot, and we jump on video or audio calls when synchronous discussion is more effective.

We're a small organization where work can sometimes get busy because elections are never rescheduled, and we care deeply about setting limits and ensuring team members have the balance they seek in their lives.

Compensation & Benefits

Compensation for full-time employment ranges from $120,000 to $180,000 depending on experience, cost of living where you live, desired workweek length. This role will have the option to work at 100% time (40 hour workweek, M-F) or 80% time (32 hour workweek, M-Th) as much of our engineering team chooses to work 80% time.

VotingWorks also provides medical, dental, and vision insurance with the base plans being fully covered for employees. VotingWorks also sponsors a 401k plan and will match 100% of contributions up to 3% and 50% of contributions up to 5%. A full list of benefits can be found here.

Diversity, Inclusion, and Equity

VotingWorks is deeply committed to building a diverse team and an inclusive work environment. We aim to build a voting system that earns American's trust, and so we must build a team that represents all Americans. We believe that a team with a diversity of life experiences and points of view is a much better team than one where “culture fit” really means “everyone is the same.” And we know that all of this is a lot easier said than done. We strive in our application process to look for proven skills and real-world experience. We rely less on which diploma you received and from which school you went to. Our interview process is built on rubrics and a scoring process we define ahead of time, so as to reduce the chance that our biases will get in the way. Finally, we welcome feedback, at all times, about anything in our recruiting process that puts you at a disadvantage for reasons unrelated to the work that needs to get done.
